alert.note: Alert for Lyon; O'Brien; Osceola; Plymouth; Sioux; Woodbury (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 19 at 2:15PM CST until December 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Iowa, southwest Minnesota and northeast Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Friday afternoon. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Thursday morning through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Those with holiday travel plans will want to monitor the forecast closely and adjust plans as necessary. Any person that becomes stranded or trapped outdoors could encounter a life-threatening situation in a short amount of time.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Lyon; O'Brien; Osceola; Plymouth; Sioux; Woodbury
